edu.cornell.gdiac.starstruck.Obstacles

Class BoxObstacle

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.cornell.gdiac.starstruck.Obstacles.Obstacle
      • edu.cornell.gdiac.starstruck.Obstacles.SimpleObstacle
        • edu.cornell.gdiac.starstruck.Obstacles.BoxObstacle
  • Direct Known Subclasses:
    BlackHole, Button, Portal, Star

    public class BoxObstacle
extends SimpleObstacle
    Box-shaped model to support collisions. Unless otherwise specified, the center of mass is as the center.

    • Constructor Detail

      • BoxObstacle

        public BoxObstacle(float width,
                   float height)
        Creates a new box at the origin. The size is expressed in physics units NOT pixels. In order for drawing to work properly, you MUST set the drawScale. The drawScale converts the physics units to pixels.
        Parameters:
        width - The object width in physics units
        height - The object width in physics units

      • BoxObstacle

        public BoxObstacle(float x,
                   float y,
                   float width,
                   float height)
        Creates a new box object. The size is expressed in physics units NOT pixels. In order for drawing to work properly, you MUST set the drawScale. The drawScale converts the physics units to pixels.
        Parameters:
        x - Initial x position of the box center
        y - Initial y position of the box center
        width - The object width in physics units
        height - The object width in physics units

    • Method Detail

      • getDimension

        public com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 getDimension()
        Returns the dimensions of this box This method does NOT return a reference to the dimension vector. Changes to this vector will not affect the shape. However, it returns the same vector each time its is called, and so cannot be used as an allocator.
        Returns:
        the dimensions of this box

      • setDimension

        public void setDimension(com.badlogic.gdx.math.Vector2 value)
        Sets the dimensions of this box This method does not keep a reference to the parameter.
        Parameters:
        value - the dimensions of this box

        public void drawDebug(GameCanvas canvas)
